title: Meryl Streep back as Miranda Priestly in Devil Wears Prada 2, 1st look out from sets
text:
Meryl Streep back as Miranda Priestly in Devil Wears Prada 2, 1st look out from sets
Meryl Streep reprises her role as Miranda Priestly in 'The Devil Wears Prada 2' with production underway in New York City. Pictures from the sets have surfaced online.
In Short
- Meryl Streep reprises her iconic role in New York City filming location
- Anne Hathaway, Emily Blunt, and Stanley Tucci join original cast reunion
- New cast members Simone Ashley and Kenneth Branagh added to sequel
Miranda Priestly is back - and the world is watching. Meryl Streep has been clciked in full fashion-command mode on the streets of New York City, reprising her iconic role for 'The Devil Wears Prada 2'.
The much-anticipated sequel to the 2006 cultural landmark sees Streep reunite with original co-stars Anne Hathaway, Emily Blunt, and Stanley Tucci, with David Frankel once again directing. New faces joining the high-fashion chaos include Simone Ashley and Kenneth Branagh.
Streep’s return, complete with her signature commanding silhouette and razor-sharp style, has reignited fan frenzy.
Set to release on May 1, 2026 - a date typically reserved for cinematic heavyweights - the film is already being dubbed fashion’s answer to a superhero event. Hathaway, back as Andy Sachs, kicked off the buzz with a social media post captioned “Andy Sachs 2025 #dwp2,” confirming that cameras are officially rolling.
New York City, the original film’s vibrant backdrop, once again plays host to Miranda’s world. This time, the plot is said to follow her navigating the shifting sands of digital media and the evolving magazine industry - an arena where relevance is fleeting, and legacy is constantly challenged. Her unwavering personal style may be more than a fashion statement - it could reflect the story’s deeper conflict of resisting change in an era that demands it.
With its powerhouse cast, glamorous setting, and sharp social commentary, 'The Devil Wears Prada 2' is poised to be more than just a sequel - it could be a defining moment for the genre. As filming continues, each sneak peek only adds to the anticipation of what could be fashion cinema’s biggest comeback.
